Jake, using Beth's hair like a rope swing, had only moved from Beth's shoulder briefly as she sneezed. As she recovered, he swung back to his position and planted his feet down for support.

"Hey," Beth said, still wiping her nose on the tissue. "Where's Steph?" Her hope was that mentioning Natasha's best friend would get Natasha to go look for her and give Beth a break. At the very least, though, it was a way for Beth to change the subject.
12222221221112111121222121.title: Beth sneezes

choices: Beth takes the opportunity to slip away
Beth decides to hang around a bit longer
122222212211121111212221212.content:
To Beth's dismay, she just happened to look over Natasha's shoulder and see Stephanie already heading toward them. Coming to a stop in front of the couch, Steph put her hands on her hips and smiled down at her guests.

"Hey Nat, hey Beth," she said, nodding to each of the girls. "What's up?"

"Hey, Steph!" Natasha nearly screamed, excited to see her friend. Then, her expression instantly changed to a goofy pout. "Beth doesn't like the perfume you picked out for me!"

Stephanie gave an amused snort and then turned to Beth, who still had her nose buried in a tissue.

"It tickles my nose," Beth confirmed, gently massaging her nostrils through the soft paper.

"Everything tickles your nose, Beth!" laughed Stephanie. "Isn't that how allergies work?"

"But I'm not allergic to perf-" Beth began, but she quickly realized neither of the other girls were listening to her. Natasha suddenly stood up and leaned her face toward Stephanie's.

"Look what I just showed Beth," she said, her voice low and sultry again. Stephanie scrunched up her face as Natasha began to nuzzle her nose too, but unlike Beth, she simply smiled and giggled.

"Oh, Natasha," Stephanie sighed, gently pushing her friend away. "How are you this drunk already?"

"What? I'm not that drunk!"
122222212211121111212221212.title: Here comes Stephanie right now

choices: Take the opportunity to try and get Beth's attention again
Take the opportunity to relax for a while
1222222122111211112122212121.content:
"Hey, I'll be right back," Beth announced quietly, then slipped out of the living room. Neither girl really acknowledged it, though -- they were too busy goofing around.

"Honest, I haven't had that much to drink," Natasha insisted, still playing with Stephanie's nose.

"Yeah, well, you're a lightweight," Stephanie responded with a laugh.

Beth needed a break from the party for a while. The stress of knowing that her finals were quickly approaching was beginning to creep back, and she thought she'd perhaps feel better if she got the chance to squeeze in another hour of studying.

After ascending the staircase, Beth opened the door to her room and shut it behind her. Then he sat back down at her desk to pick up where she had left off. Jake remained on her shoulder for the ride.

"Well, this is a lot easier for me, too!" Jake realized out loud. "No need to fear for my own safety anymore..."
1222222122111211112122212121.title: Beth takes the opportunity to slip away

12222221221112111121222121211.content:
Jake wished he could take a moment to rest, but he knew this might be his only opportunity to get Beth's help. If somebody else came in or if she decided to leave the room on her own, he might never get another shot at it. With Beth seated at her desk, climbing down wouldn't be too difficult, plus he'd have an easy place to stand and get her to notice him. The problem there was Jake really didn't know what he looked like to her. Maybe she'd think he was a bug and squish him, or even just brush him off the desk.

Beth suddenly sniffed, getting Jake's attention. He looked up at her head just in time to see her rub her fingers back and forth under her nose again. When Beth adjusted her glasses afterward, Jake realized he had a couple of options...
12222221221112111121222121211.title: Where to go...

choices: Beth is startled and pulls off her glasses
122222212211121111212221212112.content:
"All right, this won't be as bad as before," Jake reasoned. "At least now she's awake, so she should be able to notice something if I climb onto her glasses."

Walking over to Beth's head, Jake reached up and again grabbed onto the girl's hair. He pulled himself up until he was level with her cheek, and then Jake swung back and forth lightly until he could reach her face.

Grabbing hold of the skin of Beth's cheek, Jake let go of her hair and started to shimmy his way over to the front of her face. Before very long he found himself almost directly underneath Beth's right nostril.

Jake felt a gentle breeze from Beth's nose as she breathed. Knowing that the girl was particularly prone to sniffling and sneezing, however, this was not a spot he really wanted to be in for too long.

Jake reached up and grabbed more skin, pulling his body upward toward Beth's eyes. He passed her nostrils on his right, and then moved laterally again so he could climb up the bridge of her nose.

The angled bridge was a perfect place for Jake to lie on his stomach for a few seconds and rest, since he didn't have to hold on as tightly to keep from falling. When Beth reached a finger up to her nose to rub her nostrils again, though, Jake was momentarily quite startled. He hugged the nose tightly as it wobbled back and forth. As soon as Beth stopped, Jake quickly resumed crawling up toward her eyes, until he reached the bridge of her glasses.

"Phew, all right," Jake let out, catching his breath. "Now I just have to..." he grabbed the plastic frame of Beth's eyeglasses and swung himself over in front of her right eye. "Hey, Beth!" he called, kicking his legs as he dangled. "Hey!"
122222212211121111212221212112.title: Climb up to Beth's glasses

1222222122111211112122212121122.content:
It was a bit difficult to tell, but Jake would have sworn that Beth was staring right at him. Then again, he could only see one of her eyes, and the lack of an immediate reaction made him worry. Jake could only stare as Beth's eye blinked once, twice, and then it clenched shut. He was afraid that she was about to sneeze yet again, but Beth simply scrunched up her nose and rubbed her hand back and forth under her nostrils. Unfortunately, this was still less than ideal for Jake's hold on Beth's glasses. Her nose squished from side to side as she rubbed under it, and this jostled her glasses just enough to cause Jake to lose his grip. He let out a yelp as he plummeted, but luckily he didn't fall too far.

After taking a second to clear his head, Jake found himself sitting back on the tip of Beth's nose. Feeling defeated, he simply stared up at the giant girl's eyes. They were still clenched shut behind her glasses, but eventually they slowly opened. The creases in the bridge of Beth's nose disappeared as she relaxed her face and stopped rubbing her nostrils, and then to Jake's surprise, she reached a hand up to her glasses and removed them. Beth turned her glasses around and stared at the lenses from the front. Jake immediately jumped to his feet in excitement. Maybe she hadn't noticed that it was him, but she definitely noticed him in some capacity.

"Beth!" Jake shouted, waving his hands in the air. Without her glasses in the way, she might be able to see him if she crossed her eyes.

"Hey, Beth! Down here!"
1222222122111211112122212121122.title: Jake's hands slip

choices: Fine, let's go talk to Stephanie
12222221221112111121222121211221.content:
"Hmmm," Beth pondered to herself as she, squinting, scanned the front of the lenses on her glasses. She was fairly sure something had just landed on them, but now she couldn't find any evidence of that having happened. Abandoning the search, she brought her glasses down to the bottom of her shirt and gently rubbed the lenses clean with her fabric.

As her gaze shifted down to her shirt, she noticed from the corner of her eye a small black thing on the very tip of her nose. A-ha! There's -- well, whatever it is. Beth reached her right hand up to her nose and swiped it across the tip, then replaced her glasses on her face.

"AAUGH!" Jake yelped as the enormous hand squished and bent the platform he had been standing on. He immediately lost balance and fell backwards, luckily landing on Beth's finger, which he grabbed with all his strength.

Beth, somewhat curious, quickly inspected the thing that had ended up upon her nose, and then froze when she realized it wasn't simply a large piece of dust or something similar. Her eyes widened -- at first, she thought it was some sort of insect, for it seemed to have little appendages, and she experienced an instinctual pang of fright. Almost immediately, though, she recognized that this was neither an inanimate object nor an insect, and her eyes grew even wider.

"Beth! Hey, wait, don't freak out!" Jake bellowed as loud as he could.

Since Beth had already been focusing directly on Jake, this time she managed to hear him, although she wasn't quite sure she believed her own ears. Startled, the enormous girl shook her finger a little, knocking Jake off, and pushed her chair back.

"OOF!" Jake moaned as he slammed down onto the pages of Beth's textbook. Groaning, he picked himself up and looked into the slightly horrified eyes of the enormous girl. "It's me, Jake! I don't know how I ended up like this, but --"

"What -- what are you -- how are you doing that?" Beth stammered, rubbing her eyes underneath her glasses and looking around her room for evidence that she was dreaming or that someone else was messing with her.

"Well, it's like I said, I don't really know what's going on either, but you gotta take me to Stephanie. I think she knows what's going on," Jake tried to explain. "Sorry for startling you, too. I've been trying to get your attention for a while! I know this must be really hard to believe; you're not dreaming, though."

"I -- no, I must be -- really? No, this can't be real!" she protested. She was currently flooding with emotion due to the awkwardness of having a crush on Jake mixed with her inability to accept the reality of what was actually happening. She must have fallen asleep studying, and now she was having a dream about Jake because she had mentioned her feelings for him earlier to her friend and he was still on her mind. Yes, that made perfect sense!

"No, really! You're not dreaming!" Jake insisted. "I'm sure I can prove it, somehow! Would you just take me to my sister, though? It'd be a big help."
12222221221112111121222121211221.title: Finally!

choices: Beth sneezes Jake off her desk
Beth manages to hold the sneeze in
122222212211121111212221212112211.content:
Fully convinced that she was dreaming, Beth managed to let go of some of her nervousness. She leaned forward until her head was level with the edge of her desk, and she stared at the tiny Jake before her. Narrowing her eyes behind her glasses, Beth pointed a finger at Jake as she continued to scowl.

"If you're real, prove it," she said, sounding uncharacteristically confident. Jake even felt a little intimidated, though he supposed the fact that Beth was the size of a building compared to him didn't help matters. After stammering for a second, Jake blurted something out.

"I, uh... You and Steph have been friends since freshman year? We met when I was helping her move her stuff in?"

Beth only narrowed her eyes further.

"That doesn't prove anything," she grumbled. "If I'm dreaming, then maybe you just know everything I know!"

Jake rolled his eyes.

"Well, I can't tell you something only I know! How are you going to know if I'm telling the truth?"

Beth blinked, and after thinking on it for a moment, her self-conscious personality returned. She blushed subtly and she began to fidget, refusing to make eye contact with Jake.

"Right, um... Sorry. That wouldn't make any sense."

"Look, even if you are just dreaming, can't you help me out anyway? Trying to study in your dreams probably isn't going to do you any good."

Feeling defeated Beth hunched over and sighed.

"Okay, fine. I... I just... Ahh..."

Jake's eyes widened in horror as he watched Beth's face. Her eyelids fluttered behind her glasses, and her normally thin nostrils flared outward. Placing a palm on his forehead, Jake groaned quietly. This was Beth he was dealing with, and especially after everything that had happened already today, he really had no excuse for not expecting this.

"Ah... Ahhh..."

"Beth?" Jake warned, wagging a finger at the giant girl. "Don't even think about it."

If she sneezed now, Jake had no way of knowing what might happen. Maybe he'd get lucky and the force of the blast would be directed somewhere else. But, if he wasn't lucky, he might get blown right off the desk. Unfortunately, Beth seemed oblivious to Jake's words as her allergies once again took hold.

"Beth, no!"

"Ahh... Aaaahhhhh... Aaaaahhhhhhh..."
122222212211121111212221212112211.title: Prove it to me first

choices: Find Stephanie and bring her to me
Bring me with you to find Stephanie
1222222122111211112122212121122111.content:
"Oh, come on," Jake cursed his rotten luck as he realized from the look on Beth's face and the sound of her wheezy build-up that his words were not doing anything to help her fight off the tickle. Making a split-second decision, he bolted toward the end of Beth's textbook as the girl's booming inhalations continued to build.

"AAAaaahhh ... AAAAahh ..."

Knowing he had but a moment or two before she blew, Jake dove off the edge of the textbook and braced himself to land smack down on her desk.

"AAAHhh ... AA-ETCHOOOO!"

The wind from Beth's sneeze hit Jake in mid-air. Swearing as the updraft caught his body, Jake flipped over and flew much father than he had anticipated -- he crashed rather painfully into the luckily carpeted floor beside Beth's desk. Groaning, Jake spit fuzz from his mouth and examined his rug-burned hands.

Beth sniffed and grabbed a tissue. "Jake?" she called, rubbing the tissue under her nostrils. "Sorry about that ... Where'd you go?" She clearly didn't understand the gravity of the situation.

An agitated Jake stood up on the floor. "What's the matter with you?! Can't you cover your mouth when you sneeze? You blew me right off the desk!"

Beth could barely make out the words Jake was shouting. "What?" she called, looking around.

"Oh, for the love of -- I'M DOWN HERE!" he bellowed as loud as he could.

"Oh!" Beth acknowledged the tiny Jake, turning her head to the source of the now-noticeable sound. She reached out an enormous hand and put it down on the floor next to him. Jake looked up at Beth, then approached her hand and climbed into her palm, grabbing her thumb for support. Beth brought her hand back up to desk-level. "Sorry," she offered again, sniffling.

"It's okay. I guess. Just don't do it again, okay? Cover your mouth!" Jake insisted.

"Will do. So, what am I supposed to do to help?"
1222222122111211112122212121122111.title: Beth sneezes Jake off her desk

12222221221112111121222121211221112.content:
"Well, we need to get to Steph, because I think this is her doing," Jake explained. "She should know what's going on."

"What, you mean--this whole--" she gestured in a circle around Jake, indicating that she was referring to his overall size. "--you think she did this to you?" Beth asked, taken aback by the accusation. "Steph wouldn't do that, would she?" she tried to defend her friend.

"Yeah, I wouldn't put it past her. I don't know how the hell she managed to pull it off, but this has her name written all over it."

"But that's insane! I mean, if she did do it, she could have killed you!"

"Oh, definitely," Jake agreed. "Trust me, I grew up with her ... that's definitely not what she was trying to do, but she's not exactly the brightest of the bunch. She never thinks anything through."

Beth giggled a little. "This is too crazy. I mean how is this whole thing even scientifically possible?"

"How the hell should I know?" Jake laughed. "All I know is I wanna get back to normal! Look, I'll prove this is real," he declared with an idea in mind. "When was the last time you know you were awake?"

Beth thought about that. "Well, I was downstairs with Veronica, in the kitchen, and..."

"And Veronica had a beer and you had a Coca Cola. Veronica's wearing a navy blue blouse," Jake stated.

"Hmm," Beth remarked, mildly impressed. "Those could have just been lucky guesses, though. And besides, if you're a figment of my imagination, you'd know all that anyway." Beth then froze as she remembered what she and Veronica had ended up discussing in the kitchen. On the slight chance that this was all really happening, the thought of Jake having overheard her conversation with Veronica made Beth anxious, and she quickly changed the subject. "Fine, though, let's go find Steph."

"All right, finally!" Jake said, satisfied. Beth brought her hand up to her right shoulder, giving Jake a nice platform to climb onto it.

"You're gonna be okay there?" Beth asked him.

"Yeah, this is fine," Jake affirmed, climbing aboard. "Better than being in your nose," he added under his breath.

"What?" asked Beth, who had only heard a mumble of a statement.

"Nothing, nothing, we're all good. Let's find Steph!" Jake called.
12222221221112111121222121211221112.title: Bring me with you to find Stephanie

choices: Wait for Steph to come back down
122222212211121111212221212112211122.content:
Once Jake was safely in place on her shoulder, Beth left her room and headed back downstairs. It was strangely quiet: the music was still on, but the sounds of talking and dancing were absent. Once she reached the bottom of the stairs, Beth saw Veronica sitting by herself on the couch, halfway through another bottle of beer.

"Uh, hi," said Beth, peeking around the nearest corner to see if she could find where everyone else had gone.

"Hey, smartypants," replied Veronica. "I thought you were studying."

"Well, I... I was," mumbled Beth, hoping her friend wouldn't question her too much. "Have you seen Steph? Or, well, anyone for that matter?"

Veronica lifted her bottle, pointing up at the ceiling.

"They're in the attic," she groaned, sounding annoyed.

"What? Why?" asked Beth, feeling confused. Veronica shrugged.

"I dunno. They're playing some stupid game or something."

"You didn't go with them?" Beth continued, glancing up the stairs she had just come down.

"Are you kidding?" Veronica shot back, letting her head fall back against the couch. "Why in the world would I want to go up there?"

"Yeah, I don't like the attic either," Beth agreed, wrinkling her nose. "It's so dark and cramped. Plus, all that dust makes my allergies go haywire."

Veronica gave a snort of laughter, and she lazily tried to hide her face behind her free hand as Beth stared at her.

"What?" Beth demanded, starting to blush. Veronica laughed again and shook her head.

"Oh, Beth," she giggled. "You're just so... You."

"Whatever," Beth groaned, rolling her eyes. Stepping away from Veronica, she turned her head slightly to look toward Jake, as if to ask him what to do next.
122222212211121111212221212112211122.title: Stephanie is not downstairs

choices: Beth gets lured into staying in the attic
1222222122111211112122212121122111221.content:
Jake looked up at Beth as she turned her head toward him. "To the attic, then?" he asked her, knowing that she wasn't a fan but also that there were very few options right now.

Beth gave Jake a look of uncertainty, then turned back to Veronica. "All right, we -- I gotta go see Steph, so I'll be back in a bit."

"Suit yourself!" Veronica smiled, taking a drink from her beer. "I'll be right here."

With that, Beth shuffled off to the little closet upstairs, which had been engineered into a small passageway to the attic. She stopped before climbing the little steps; she could hear the girls laughing and talking up there. "Ok, Jake, I don't know what you wanna do. I'm not gonna be able to just confront Steph about this -- she's with everyone else. I don't wanna make a scene."

Jake sighed. "Fine. I don't know, can you try getting her to come downstairs to talk in private?"

"I guess," Beth replied. "I'm not that good at coming up with something, though. What should I say?"

"I don't know, Beth. Tell her Veronica's looking for her or something. Tell her the toilet's not flushing, or--" Jake paused momentarily, his eyes lighting up. "Oh, I got it! Tell her I just showed up to the party! That'll really confuse her, since she already knows I came early but doesn't know you know!"

"Oh, that's good! Okay," Beth responded appreciatively. "If it doesn't work, though, and we're just up there with all of them, are you gonna try to get to Steph yourself or stick with me?"

"Uh, I don't know ... we'll figure it out. It'll work though, don't worry."

Reassured, Beth climbed the wooden steps up to the attic.
1222222122111211112122212121122111221.title: Go up to the attic

12222221221112111121222121211221112212.content:
Jake's words had given Beth a bit of a confidence boost, but she was still feeling nervous as she climbed the stairs to the attic. To make matters worse, dust immediately began to tickle its way into Beth's nostrils. She stopped halfway up the stairs and rubbed her nose, letting out a frustrated groan. Jake was tempted to tell Beth to keep going, but he knew he was already asking a lot of her. It quickly became apparent that the itch in her nose wasn't going to go away, so Beth decided to quit stalling and push forward. Peeking her head through the top of the staircase, Beth spotted the other girls sitting in a rough circle.

"Hi, Beth!" greeted Brianna, being the first to notice the new arrival. Stephanie and Natasha turned to the staircase at the sound of their companion's voice, and although they were all friends, Beth felt a bit nervous being stared down by the three of them.

"Uh, hey," Beth replied, continuing the rest of the way up the stairs. The ceiling in the attic was only barely tall enough for her to stand up, and even then, only in the center. Hunching over awkwardly, Beth shuffled a bit closer to the others.

"What are you guys doing up here?" asked Beth, feeling too nervous to try pulling Stephanie away right off the bat.

"Truth or dare," Brianna answered with a giggle. Beth raised an eyebrow. Now she understood why Veronica wanted nothing to do with this. Weren't they a little old for truth or dare?

"Okay," mumbled Beth in acknowledgement. "Well, I-"

"Come play with us!" Natasha interrupted, patting the floor between herself and Stephanie. Beth shook her head, but before she could respond, two of the girls grabbed her and gently pulled her into the group. The sudden movement kicked up a cloud of dust, and Beth found herself plopped down with Natasha on her right and Stephanie on her left. Jake tugged on Beth's hair to try to get her back on track, but she was too distracted to notice.

"Ah... Haahh..." Beth breathed, feeling a sneeze coming on. Her eyes fluttered behind her glasses and she waved a hand up and down in front of her face. Once Jake realized what was about to happen, he grabbed another lock of Beth's hair and held on tight.

"Alright, who wants to go next?" asked Stephanie, looking back and forth between her friends.

"Ahhh... HA-CHOOO!" Beth suddenly sneezed, her head bobbing forward into the center of the circle.

"Thanks for volunteering, Beth!" teased Natasha, slapping the timid girl on the back.

"What!? But I-"

"Truth or dare?"
12222221221112111121222121211221112212.title: Beth gets lured into staying in the attic

122222212211121111212221212112211122121.content:
"No, guys, I w--" Beth tried to protest.

"Come on, Beth!" Brianna chimed in. "Play with us!"

Beth sighed. "Okay, fine. Truth," she chose, reasoning that it was the easier choice.

"Okay ... Hmm ... Is it true that ..." Natasha began, looking around the attic and thinking. "Is it true that you have a crush on someone?"

"Oh, come on, Nat, what are we still in middle school?" Brianna criticized. "We can come up with a better one than that."

"It's an easy one! But we're just getting started!" Natasha defended herself. "So?" she asked, turning to Beth.

Beth's face went a little pink, and she rolled her eyes. "Sure, I guess. Kinda," she admitted, rubbing her nose. The other girls smiled a little. Beth's answer was somewhat interesting to them, given her shy nature, but without knowing on whom the crush actually was, it wasn't exactly earth-shattering information.

Jake's ears had perked up upon hearing the question posed to Beth. He recalled how he had learned earlier that Beth's crush was apparently on him. He looked around the room, thinking about what to do next. Stephanie was not sitting directly next to Beth, so getting to her would not be that simple.

"Okay! Now it's your turn, Beth," Stephanie said.

"Right. Okay ..." Beth began.
122222212211121111212221212112211122121.title: Truth

choices: Beth tries to talk to Stephanie
Beth waits for Brianna to come back
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.content:
Beth had already been feeling nervous about trying to get Stephanie away from the group, and being asked about having a crush only amplified her self-consciousness. She was too worried that everyone would think it was weird if she pulled Steph away, so she decided to play along for now and hopefully make things seem more casual. After looking back and forth between the other girls, Beth eventually settled on Brianna. If nothing else, she was always nice...

"Brianna," Beth said, rubbing her nose again. "Truth or dare?"

"Hmm..." Brianna pondered, placing a hand on her chin and staring up at the ceiling. "Dare!"

Beth hesitated for a moment. She realized she had no idea what to ask for, regardless of whether Brianna had chosen truth or dare. As she tried to think of something, the attic's dusty air began to tickle her nose again.

"Okay, I... I d-dare you to... To... Haahh... I dare you t-to... Ahh... Ah-Ahh... HA-CHOO!"

"You dare me to sneeze?" asked Brianna with a giggle. Beth rubbed her nose and tried to shake her head.

"No, I... I dare you to... I daahhh... Ah-CHOOOO!!!"

Beth gave a big sneeze, causing Stephanie and Natasha to recoil away from her. Straightening up, Beth furiously rubbed her fingers back and forth under her nose, feeling like the irritation inside might never stop. Eventually she did manage to get the itchiness down to a bearable level, and after taking in a deep sniff she forced her eyes open and turned her attention back to Brianna.

"I... Ugh. I just dare you to get me a box of tissues or something," Beth groaned, pressing her nostrils against her forearm.

"Wow, lame," Natasha teased, but Brianna didn't seem to mind.

"Nah, it's okay," she said, standing up and walking past her friends back toward the stairs. "I'll be right back!"

After watching Brianna descend the stairs and leave the attic, Beth dragged her tickly nose across her forearm and turned back to the other girls. Maybe she could have planned this better. Now Brianna was gone, and she was stuck with Steph and Natasha...
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.title: Beth chooses Brianna

choices: Beth excuses herself to go talk to Stephanie
Beth can't get away from the game
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.content:
Jake was still clinging to Beth's hair. It was too risky now to try and move toward Stephanie; Beth could sneeze at any moment, and he wanted to be secure if she did. Leaning over to Beth's ear, Jake whispered loud enough so that only she could hear him: "Beth! Try to dare Steph to do something downstairs, too! Then maybe we can follow her."

Beth gave a tiny nod that neither of the other girls noticed. "H-hey, St--"

"So I guess one of us can go while Bri's downstairs," said Steph, who hadn't heard Beth's attempt to speak with her. "I mean, it's her turn, but she can go when she gets back. You go, Nat."

"Okay," Natasha began. "Hmm. Well I'd dare you to chug your beer, but you don't have much left. Mine's empty, too. So, I dare you to get us more beers, oh generous host," she laughed.

That's perfect! Beth didn't even have to do anything. Now we have to follow her, though, Jake thought.

Stephanie sighed. "All right. Beth, do you want anything?"

Beth shook her head. "I'm fine, thanks," she said, sniffing. The dust in the attic was really horrible.

"Okay, then, I'll be back," Stephanie announced, getting up and moving toward the door. "Oh, look who it is," she said as Brianna climbed up the stairs at the same time.

"Got the tissues!" she exclaimed, holding the box up in the air.

Stephanie asked if Brianna wanted a drink, too, and after receiving an affirmative response, set off down the stairs. "Here you go," Brianna said, handing the box of tissues to Beth.

"Thaaa ... haa ... HA-CHOOO! Thank you," Beth replied, pulling out a tissue just in time to catch her sneeze. She blew her nose into it.

Brianna laughed. "Sure thing! So it's my turn now."
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.title: Beth tries to talk to Stephanie

1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.content:
Brianna could tell that Beth was nervous, so she decided to give her a break. She turned to Natasha and pointed, prompting the other girl to give her a sly smile.

"Natasha," Brianna began, starting to smile herself. "Truth or dare?"

"Ummm..." Natasha said out loud as she tried to decide. Beth decided to take the opportunity to make her move. Clutching her tissue box with one hand, she quietly stood up and made her way toward the stairs. Natasha didn't seem to notice, and while Brianna did, she simply gave Beth a smile and a nod. Beth nodded back, and then she descended the stairs as calmly as she could. Once she arrived at the bottom, she drew another tissue from her box and blew her nose again.

"Sorry," Beth said under her breath, sniffing and wiping her nose with the used tissue. "All that dust was killing me."

"It's okay," Jake replied, his spirits lifted now that he had a shot at getting to Stephanie. "Sorry for making you do that."

Beth blushed, feeling butterflies in her stomach. She held her tissue against her nostrils again and sniffled into it.

"N-no problem," she mumbled, hiding a smile behind the tissue.

"Alright, let's go get Steph."
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.title: Beth excuses herself to go talk to Stephanie

choices: Veronica stays, leaving Beth and Stephanie alone
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.content:
"Right!" Beth agreed. She turned to the staircase that led down to the living room and descended it, making her way to the kitchen. As she passed by the living room, Beth noticed that Veronica was no longer lying on the couch.

"Ah, so you did want a drink!" Stephanie teasingly greeted Beth as she entered the kitchen.

"Oh," Beth laughed a little in response. "No, uh, I really just needed a little break from all the dust."

Veronica was in the kitchen, too, rummaging through the refrigerator for another drink. It's so hard to get her alone! Jake thought, frustrated.

"Understandable. Wanna help me take some of these up there?" Stephanie asked, referring to the bottles of beer she was pulling out of a cooler.

"Um, sure, yeah," Beth agreed, sniffing lightly. It was good to be in fresher air -- she wasn't looking forward to going back to the attic, but if she was lucky she might be able to intercept Stephanie alone before they returned upstairs.

Veronica finally decided on a drink from the fridge. "You guys are still playing truth or dare?" she asked, a little disapprovingly.

"Yeah, it's just starting to get good. Come on, come up and play with us! Don't sit down here alone," Stephanie insisted.

No! Stay here! We need her alone just for a second! Jake begged mentally.
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.title: Beth finds Stephanie with Veronica

1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.content:
"Ugh, fine," groaned Veronica, making Beth's heart drop. She tried to hide how frustrated she was as Veronica and Stephanie stepped past her, and then she decided to lag behind a bit so she could try to formulate a plan with Jake.

"This isn't working!" Beth whined under her breath, turning her eyes to the side. Jake was still out of her view, but she could at least tell he was there.

"Yeah, it might be even harder to separate them now. Well, they'll have to stop eventually. I guess just stick with Steph, and eventually you might be able to get her alone."

"Okay, if you say so," mumbled Beth, rubbing a finger under her nose as she followed her friends up the stairs. Just thinking about going back into that dusty attic was making her nose tickle again. In fact, she was even feeling a bit tempted to refuse Jake's request. She had no reason to make herself suffer, and she wouldn't miss anything by staying downstairs and simply waiting for Stephanie to come back. Upon reaching the staircase that led up to the attic, Beth paused and considered her options.
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.title: Veronica agrees to come upstairs

1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.content:
"On second though, you guys, I'm gonna hang down here for a while," Beth called to Steph and Veronica, who were climbing back up the stairs to the attic.

Stephanie, who was ahead of Veronica, paused and turned back to her friend. "Aww, really? The game was getting good, though!" she pouted.

"Yeah, but I really just need a bit more of a break," Beth insisted, sniffing again. "The dust is really bad, you know?"

What are you doing? What about the plan?! Jake thought frantically, not realizing that Beth had invented a potentially superior plan.

"Just come get me in like 10 minutes, okay?" Beth asked her friend.

"Okay, okay. Come on, Veronica." The two girls resumed their ascent into the attic.

Beth backed up into the hallway. "Come on, Beth!" Jake pleaded from the girl's shoulder. "We were so close to Steph!"

"Yeah, but this will work better, trust me!" Beth spoke back toward her shoulder. "As long as we're up there, we can't get her alone anyway. This way we can just wait until she comes back to get me."

"Hmmm. Yeah, I guess that is a better plan," Jake admitted, twirling Beth's hair. "So ... are we gonna wait here, or what?"
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.title: Wait downstairs

choices: Jake and Beth sit and talk
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.content:
"We can-"

Beth stopped abruptly, realizing what she was about to say. She blushed lightly and absently pressed the tips of her index fingers together.

"We can wait in my room," she said in a quiet, shy voice. Jake stared up at the side of Beth's head as she awkwardly adjusted her glasses.

"I guess that's fine," Jake replied, oblivious as to why Beth suddenly seemed so nervous. In the excitement of the moment before, he'd forgotten all about everything he heard. Maybe it would come back to him, but for the time being it had completely slipped his mind. Jake held on to Beth's hair as she walked back to her room, and then she sat down at her desk. Letting out a relaxed sigh, Beth reached for the tissue box next to her textbooks.

"Ugh, sorry," Beth said with a sniff, grabbing a tissue. "I wouldn't have minded staying up there so much, but the dust really aggravates my allergies."

"That's ok," Jake mumbled, not really sure what else to say. He stared off into space as Beth brought the tissue up to her nose and blew loudly. "So, uh, now what do we do?"
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.title: Go back to Beth's room

choices: Stephanie comes back to grab Beth
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.content:
"Umm," Beth considered. "I don't know ... we just have to wait about 10 minutes and then hopefully Steph will come back down."

Jake, who was growing tired of sitting on Beth's shoulder, had already begun carefully sliding himself down her arm. He was on his way to the floor for a change of scenery.

"Hey, where are you going?" Beth asked, a little concerned when she realized the tiny Jake had left his post.

"Just need to move around a bit," Jake explained, now scaling his way down Beth's leg. He leapt when he reached her ankle and landed on the floor.

"All right ... be careful!" the girl instructed. "You should have told me you were moving; I might have stepped on you if I didn't know," she shuddered.

"Don't worry, I'm getting used to navigating at this size," Jake reluctantly admitted. He set off toward the other side of Beth's room, trudging through the carpet and admiring the views of enormous furniture. "Nice room you got here."

"Thanks," Beth giggled. "Probably looks less spectacular when you're not so small."

"Well, hopefully we'll find out soon!"
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.title: Jake wanders around Beth's room

choices: Stephanie drags Beth out of her room
Beth manages to get Stephanie to stay
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.content:
Having already been to Beth's bed, Jake decided to explore other areas of her room. He didn't get far, however, as he heard footsteps rapidly approaching from the stairs. He tried to run back to Beth, but with his tiny size, his speed was limited. Beth got up from her chair and tried to retrieve Jake herself, but her door suddenly swung open before she could so much as bend over. Jake wasn't sure whether to be relieved or terrified as he saw his sister standing in the doorway.

"Steph!" Beth yelped, her voice squeaking in shock.

"Beth!" Stephanie shouted back, quickly stepping into the room. She grabbed Beth's wrist and began to drag her back out toward the hall. "Come on, we need you!"

"Hang on, wait a second! Stephanie!" pleaded Beth, glancing back and forth between her friend and the last spot she saw Jake on the carpet. She struggled against Stephanie's grip, but she wasn't sure if she'd be able to hold her back.
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.title: Stephanie comes back to grab Beth

1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.content:
"Wait, Steph, wait! I have to show you something!" Beth protested. Although she wasn't able to physically best Stephanie, Beth's words caught Stephanie's attention.

Stephanie, curious, paused from dragging her friend away for a moment to inquire. "Huh? What do you need to show me?" She released her grip on Beth's forearm.

"C'mere," Beth instructed, heading back into her room. "Look, it's something you should see."

Jake still occupied the same spot on Beth's carpet, but his tiny size did make him easy to misplace. He waved his arms above his head to try to make his presence more apparent. "Hey, down here!"
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.title: Beth manages to get Stephanie to stay

1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.content:
Stephanie made a face as she watched Beth get on her hands and knees, and then she visibly recoiled when she saw her friend looking for something in the carpet.

"Ew! Is it a bug!?" Stephanie demanded, holding up an arm as if to protect herself. Beth shook her head and pushed her glasses up the bridge of her nose.

"Ugh, it's not a bug. It should be right... Here..."

As soon as the word left Beth's lips, she happened to catch sight of Jake. He was waving frantically to get her attention, but once he realized he'd been spotted, he calmed down and gave the giant girl a smile. Beth smiled back, and then she lifted a hand and began to reach it toward Jake to gently pick him up. Before she could, however...

"Ahh..."

Jake's smile instantly became an expression of pure fear. Beth's eyelids had started to droop, and her nostrils flared and contracted rapidly as she took a shuddery breath. Maybe it was some dust from the carpet, but knowing Beth, it was equally likely that someone had just looked at her the wrong way.

"Ah-Ahh-Ahhh-!"

"Beth, no!" pleaded Jake, trying to wrap his arms and legs around some of the carpet's shag.

"Don't sneeze!"

"Aaaahhh-!"
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.title: Beth locates Jake

choices: Stephanie drags Beth out of her room
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.content:
The last thing Jake saw before he shut his eyes and hugged the carpet strand for dear life was Beth's face looming inches away from him: her nostrils flared madly and her eyes shut in desperation as her breath hitched.

"Aaahh ... AAAHh!"

Beth didn't want to (quite literally) blow all the hard work she and Jake had gone through to get Stephanie alone with them, but this sneeze was not something she was going to be able to fight off. Doing the next best thing, Beth tried to turn her face down so that her shirt, rather than Jake, would get the full blast of it...

"HACHOOOO!" the girl sneezed, spraying herself as well as the immediate area before her.

Jake lost his grip on the carpet as Beth's sneeze smacked him in the face, and he was violently blown back a few feet across her room. Coming to, a dizzy Jake on his back lifted his head up to see Beth sniffing loudly and rubbing her nose with her hand.

"Really, Beth? You made me come all the way down here to watch you sneeze?" Stephanie joked. "You could have down that up in the attic! Now, come on!"

Beth opened her watery eyes and scanned the room for Jake's new location. "No, really! Ugh, my stupid allergies! He was right here, I swear!"

"What are you talking about, Beth?" Stephanie demanded, growing impatient. "What is it?"

"It's," Beth sniffed again. "It's ... your brother."

Beth was looking at the carpet and not at Stephanie, so she didn't see how Stephanie's expression briefly became one of panic as she considered what might be going on. Stephanie instinctively made a move to play dumb and get Beth out of the room.

"Oh, well let's go! We'll talk about him in the attic!" she blurted out, grabbing Beth's arm again.

"No, wait!"
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.title: Beth sneezes, blowing Jake away

1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.content:
"Steph, wait!" yelped Beth, struggling against her friend's grip once again. This time Stephanie wasn't having any of it, and Beth was powerless to resist. Meanwhile, Jake broke into a full-on sprint toward the girls. He wasn't about to let this opportunity go to waste, even if the circumstances had become far from ideal. Beth nearly squished him as she tried to take a step back away from the doorway, but afterward Jake managed to grab on to the side of her shoe. Unable to do much else, he simply held on for dear life as his sister dragged Beth out of the bedroom and back up the stairs into the attic.

Beth stopped struggling when they reached the staircase, and she climbed into the attic ahead of Stephanie. For a moment Jake found himself right in front of his sister's face as she began to ascend the stairs right behind Beth, but it was far too dark for him to have any chance of being spotted. Once they reached the top, Jake and Beth discovered that the other girls had already left, finally leaving them alone with Stephanie.

"Steph, I-" Beth tried to speak up, but Stephanie cut her off by slamming the trap door that covered the top of the staircase, plunging the attic into pitch darkness. After sitting down on top of the closed trap door, Stephanie took out her phone and began to use it as a flashlight. Realizing she had nowhere to go, Beth sat down as well. Jake took the opportunity to climb down from her shoe, and he found himself standing in between Beth and his sister. There was no way either of them would be able to see him in such dim light, but since they were both sitting nearby...
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.title: Stephanie drags Beth out of her room

1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.content:
Jake mulled over the situation. His goal was to confront his sister and get back to normal size. However, he trusted Beth over Stephanie and could use Beth's help...

Backtracking, Jake retreated to Beth's shoe and climbed it again. Then he made his way across her leg to her waist.

"So, um," Beth sniffed. The dust was already beginning to bother her. "Where is everyone?"

"Downstairs. Just me and you," Stephanie responded.

"Right," Beth agreed, wondering how Jake was doing somewhere back in her room. "So, you said we were gonna talk about Jake?"

"Oh, right!" Stephanie interjected. She had clearly come up with a plan to manipulate the conversation as she dragged her friend upstairs. "You have a crush on him. I know that's what you were gonna tell me."

"What?" an embarrassed Beth replied. "No, I ... well, that's not ... that's not what I--"

"Come on, Beth, you're my friend! I know you have a thing for him," Stephanie interrupted. Anything to redirect the conversation from the accusation Stephanie thought Beth might administer.

Jake tuned out the girls as he focused on climbing. He had made it to Beth's right shoulder. If he wanted her attention he'd probably need to move closer to her face again. Then again, it was so dark that that might be useless. He supposed he could also stay put and wait to see if Beth made any progress with Stephanie.
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.title: Jake climbs Beth

1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.content:
Jake weighed his options. It wasn't an easy decision. He definitely trusted Beth over Stephanie, but his ultimate goal was to confront his sister and get back to a normal size ...

Making a hasty choice, he bolted across the floor to Stephanie while she was still sitting. He made it to her left hand, which was placed palm-down on the ground for extra support, and began to climb.

"Isn't there, um, a light in here we can turn on?" Beth questioned. The light from Stephanie's phone wasn't much.

"The bulb blew out before," Stephanie explained.

There was an awkward pause. Beth had already mentioned Jake, and it was clear that Stephanie did not want to discuss him, though she had said she would in passing while dragging Beth out of her room. For Jake's sake, though, Beth mustered up the courage to press on.

"Okay. So ... about Jake," Beth began.

"Oh, Beth, I know you have a crush on him!" Stephanie expertly deflected.

"What? No, I ... that's not what I ..." Beth's cheeks flushed red, though the lighting was too dim for anyone to notice.

As the girls went back and forth, Jake made significant progress. He had made it to his sister's shoulder. Grabbing on to some of her blonde hair for support, he stood and bellowed at her ear: "Hey! She's talking about this! Why the hell am I so small?!"

Stephanie didn't hear her brother, though, because she was still engaged in distracting Beth. Jake made his way to Stephanie's face. With the current lighting, he could really only make out her eyes clearly, which reflected green. Under these conditions, it would be a little risky to move onto her face. Still, his sister's lack of allergies meant he was not likely to be sneezed off her face suddenly, as was always the risk with Beth.
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.title: Jake climbs Stephanie

choices: Beth finally confronts Stephanie about Jake's situation
Stephanie has completely changed the subject
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.content:
Jake decided to seize what might be his only chance to confront his sister. It was, after all, what Beth and he had been working toward, and he didn't want to waste any more time. It was so dark, though, that he feared slipping and falling off of her face as he scaled it.

Thinking on his feet, Jake grabbes a bundle of Stephanie's long hair as a grappling rope, and made his way to his sister's cheek. He wrapped the hair around himself and tucked it into his belt to free his hands, and then began climbing.

Jake made his way across his sister's face medially, moving closer to her sensory organs since his goal was to get her attention at the opportune moment. On his way over to her upper lip, he miscalculated a movement on account of the darkness and his heart skipped a beat as he thought for a moment he might fall, but, luckily, his hair rope worked as intended and prevented this.

Jake came to a stop just a tiny bit away from the underside of Stephanie's left nostril. Looking up, he could see an enormous green eye. Looking down -- well, Jake stopped himself from looking down, but could feel his feet planted relatively securely on his sister's lip. He had been tuning out the conversation between Stephanie and Beth, but he now took a moment to listen in...
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.title: Go to Stephanie's face

choices: Right here! *Jake stick Stephanie's hair up her nose*
Right here! *Jake climbs to Stephanie's eyes to wave*
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.content:
What a perfect time to listen in:

"Anyways, Steph, what I was trying to say was ... Jake is -- well, he's tiny! I mean he's actually shrunken, and he says you know about it and I don't really care right now if you do know why or how he is, I just need help getting him back to normal because it's not safe for him to be that small," Beth blurted out, feeling absolutely ridiculous as she did so.

Jake couldn't help but feel proud of her. There we go! Good job, Beth!

For a moment Stephanie had to internalize the situation. On one level she had known that there was a risk of someone else finding out what she did to her brother, yet she hadn't actually planned how to react. She could play completely dumb and react the way any normal person would to someone else's claim that a human being could be shrunken down to the size of a small insect (likely with dismissive laughter and concern for the other person's sanity). However, she was caught off guard by Beth's unusual assertiveness and froze, which she realized would make this very unconvincing now. At the same time, Stephanie couldn't simply admit to doing what she did; she did, in fact, feel some shame and her defenses wouldn't allow this.

"Oh -- I, um -- what do mean he's tiny, exactly?" Stephanie asked, as if this wasn't a completely bizarre situation and merely one that required a bit more clarification.

"I mean he's literally the size of an ant and we have to do something to help him get back to normal size before he gets crushed," Beth explained, somewhat impressed at her own confidence now.

"Okay," Stephanie replied slowly. "So, where exactly is he now?"

"Well, he was on the floor of my room before you dragged me out, and now, well..." Beth's voice trailed off as she did not know Jake's current location.

"Hmm?" Stephanie pressed, thinking Beth might actually know but be afraid to say.
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.title: Beth finally confronts Stephanie about Jake

1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.content:
As Stephanie and Beth went back and forth, Jake remembered that Beth most likely didn't know he'd managed to tag along. He'd have to find some way to reveal himself to Steph on his own. It was too dark for her to see him, especially since she'd be more likely to be looking for him on Beth's body than her own, and it was fairly likely that she wouldn't be able to hear him either. Tipping his head back, Jake looked up Stephanie's nostril. He could always climb up there and make her sneeze, but the attic was dusty enough that she might not think anything of it. He'd have to get more creative than that.

Beth felt herself starting to panic. For all she knew, Jake was still trying to survive on the floor of her bedroom. To make matters worse, her allergies were constantly prodding at the back of her mind. Dust flowed up into her nose every time she inhaled, and she was already starting to feel another sneeze coming on. Stephanie's body language was making Beth suspicious that she really did know what was going on, so if she ended up being distracted by a sneezing fit, Stephanie might try to get away. Trying her hardest not to think about it, Beth firmly rubbed a finger back and forth under her nose and tried to think. Even if she didn't know where Jake was, maybe she could at least say something to stall Steph or catch her off guard.

As she thought, Beth caught sight of something out of the corner of her eye. A thin lock of hair was starting to slide across Stephanie's face, inching ever closer to her nose. She only noticed because it looked less like it was falling of its own accord and more like it was being pulled. Not long after Beth realized what was happening, the ends of the hairs were suddenly turned upward.

"Hey, Steph!" yelled Jake, hoping his sister would notice him. "I'm right here!"

With that, Jake shoved the lock of hair into Stephanie's nostril as far as he could manage. It probably wouldn't get very deep, but hopefully it would be enough for Steph to realize that hadn't just happened on its own.
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.title: Right here! *Jake stick Stephanie's hair up...

choices: Jake goes up the nose for safety
Jake tries to get far away from Stephanie's nose
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.content:
Jake stood on his sister's lip, his arms outstretched above him, still grasping the strands of hair whose tips brushed up against the sensitive inside of Stephanie's nose.

Jake immediately noticed the nostrils flare in response to the poke and he nearly lost his balance when Stephanie's lip quivered as she wrinkled her nose.

"Ugh," Stephanie complained, rubbing the bridge of her nose with her finger.

"What is it?" Beth asked, momentarily distracted from trying to convince Stephanie to help find Jake.

"No, nothing really, it just felt like something poked me up the nose. Maybe you're right about the dust, wanna go back downstairs?" Stephanie was eager to change the subject.

Beth didn't respond. She was a smart girl, and the out-of-place hairs she had noticed plus what Stephanie just said seemed much too coincidental ... But Jake wouldn't have been able to make it up to the attic by himself, would he?

"Well, I guess I got her attention," Jake said to himself, holding on to Stephanie's septum now to avoid falling while she rubbed at the bridge of her nose. His concern now was that she would rub at the bottom of her nose and knock him off ... something he hadn't thought about earlier. Now might be a good time to get out of the way.
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.title: The hair tickles Steph's nose

1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.content:
If Stephanie was rubbing at the bridge of her nose now, it was likely only a short moment of time before she would start rubbing at her nostrils -- and, in doing so, knock Jake clean off her face.

Making a split-second decision, Jake hoisted himself up inside his sister's left nostril and plopped himself down next to the giant bundle of Stephanie's hairs that Jake had just shoved up her nose.

Sure enough, as Jake was catching his breath, Stephanie moved her index finger down to the underside of her nose and started to rub at it. Jake covered his face as his moist surroundings caved in on him and squished him around. It was over rather quickly, though, and the fact that he had not been knocked to the floor told Jake he made a smart decision.

Stephanie sniffed, whipping Jake in the face with a rush of air. The attic was too dark for her to see that her own hairs were stuck up her nose, but she could certainly feel the maddening tickle they caused.

Meanwhile, Beth was trying to figure out what was going on. Jake was just messing with MY nose a short while ago -- is this is a sign from him? It has to be... "Tissue?" she offered Steph, figuring that was the safest way to get Jake out in the open. It wasn't a perfect plan, though -- she couldn't let Stephanie crumple the tissue up afterward...
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.title: Jake goes up the nose for safety

1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.content:
Jake groaned and rolled his eyes as soon as he overheard the question. It was a running joke in their family that Steph was too squeamish to blow her nose except in the most dire circumstances, for fear of what she’d see in the tissue afterwards.

“N-no, that’s fine.” Stephanie answered, sounding slightly nervous. “It’s just a little dust.”

Next to Jake, Steph’s hairs swayed languidly in the wind of her breathing. They’d started out as a bundle, but the sharp gust of her sniff had separated them, each blond strand curling off in a different direction to tickle its own corner of Stephanie’s nose. Jake watched, wincing as the huge structure scrunched uncomfortably around him. This had to be irritating her nose something fierce. Something else felt off, though. Was it just him, or was the slimy pink floor slimier that it had been a moment ago…?
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.title: Stephanie doesn't accept the tissue

choices: Beth slips the hairs out of Stephanie's nose
Beth purposely tickles Stephanie's nose with the hairs
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.content:
"That's not good," Jake declared, observing the increased moisture in his environment. He stood up gingerly, trying to avoid becoming any wetter, and began to think about what he should do.

Beth was also trying to plan a new course of action. Her attempt to get Stephanie to blow her nose had failed and she needed to try something else to save Jake if he was, in fact, inside his sister's nose.

The light in the attic was extremely dim, but Beth turned the light on her phone up and directed it toward the ceiling. "Hey, what's that, Steph?" Beth asked casually, pointing to the ceiling. Although it was quite unlikely she'd be able to spot Jake at his size and under these lighting conditions, Beth thought that if she could get her friend to look up she might be able to notice something awry.

"Hm?" Stephanie responded with mild interest, turning her head up toward the ceiling and exposing her nostrils. Beth quickly checked them out. Everything looked normal, except -- was that a strand of Stephanie's hair?

"Oh, I guess it wasn't anything. Hold on, though, Steph, you got a little something here," said Beth, reaching for the hairs stuck up Stephanie's nose.
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.title: Beth tries something else

choices: Steph's nose just gets really stuffy...
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.content:
Well, if she needed to get Jake out of Steph's nose Beth knew one really fast way. Granted, it wouldn't be very pleasant, but Jake had been through one of her sneezes already, he'd be fine. Probably. No permeant damage anyway. Before she could second-guess herself, Beth's fingers closed delicately around the hair near Stephanie's cheek and moved quickly to the blonde's nostril, pushing another two or three inches up inside it.

The response was immediate and dramatic. Stephanie's nostrils flared up violently and her nose scrunched dramatically, protesting the intruder in it's deepest and most sensitive areas. "H-Hey, what are y-you...?" Steph protested.

"Hold still, I've almost got it!" Beth lied. Impressive as it was, she knew Steph wasn't going to sneeze from just that. Mentally apologizing to both her friend and Jake, she started jiggling the hairs erratically, making them tickle and itch up against the sensitive membranes deep inside Steph's nasal cavity. She was clearly having an effect: even in the dim light, she could see her Steph's nostrils quivering and starting to turn pink around the edges, her eyes starting to water from the intense tickle Beth was provoking. Out of the corner of her eye she spotted Steph's chest starting to rise more dramatically than usual.

"...hehhh..."

'Come on Steph, just sneeze already!' Beth mentally urged. It seemed like it was working but she'd never done this before, she didn't know if she'd actually be able to coax the twitchy nose in front of her into exploding...
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.title: Beth purposely tickles Stephanie's nose wit...

1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.content:
"Sorry, it's a little stuck! Almost there," Beth carried on, twirling the curly hairs deep up inside her friend's nostril. At this point it didn't really matter how unconvincing her charade was -- Stephanie was on the verge of exploding.

Stephanie's nose tickled so badly now that part of her welcomed the imminent sneeze. Still, she couldn't help but be annoyed with her friend at the same time -- just what the hell was going on anyway? Was this some kind of prank? Beth was never one for practical jokes...

"HAaaa ... AAHhhh ..." the blonde let out, squeezing her teary eyes shut and inhaling once more for the grand finale. Meanwhile, her brother grabbed on to one of her nose hairs for support as he could hear loudly and clearly what was about to go down.

"ATCHEEEEW!" Jake's sister sneezed, blasting the hairs out of her nostril and spraying Beth's hand, which recoiled.

"Oh, whoops!" Beth tried to react as if she hadn't seen this coming. "Got it! Sorry, I guess that tickled, huh?"

Stephanie opened her puffy, red eyes, looked up at Beth, and embarassedly wiped her nose.
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.title: Steph sneezes!

choices: Stephanie notices and rubs her nose
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.content:
The enormous nostrils above him twitched involuntarily as Jake made contact with the hair. Yes! Jake thought, feeling triumphant. He paused and waited for some reaction beyond that ... but after a few moments, it became clear that that was it.

Stephanie was concentrated on the fact that Beth knew what was going on with her brother, and didn't even register the fact that some of her own hairs had just been shoved up her nostril (albeit not very far). Beth had actually noticed more about what Jake was doing than Stephanie had!

"Hmm," Jake declared, a little disappointed. Not discouraged, though, Jake moved his right hand further away from the tip of the hairs and started shimmying them upward, pushing more and more of the length of the hair into his sister's nose. "She's gotta notice it eventually!" he reasoned.
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.title: Steph doesn't seem to notice

choices: Try to get her to sneeze him out
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.content:
Jake never saw it coming. He was so focused on feeding the hair hand over hand into the immense pink cavern above him, watching it rub and bend against the delicate but frustratingly unresponsive membrane, that he never saw the wall of flesh speeding up behind him. The impact of Stephanie’s finger knocked him bodily into her gaping nostril, and he fell flat on his face on the slimy ground inside.

Groaning, Jake rolled over... and froze as her saw what was happening. The movement of Steph’s rubbing was making the hair dance and tickle across the roof of her nose, far more dramatically than anything he’d been able to do. The nostril underneath him quivered, flaring...

Liz watched in horror as Stephanie rubbed her nose, idly at first, but then more urgently. Jake was in there! At the same time, though, she couldn’t help feeling a little bad for Stephanie. Liz was intimately familiar with times when rubbing only seemed to make her nose itchier and itchier, and that seemed to be exactly what was happening to her friend. Steph’s nose twitched and scrunched under her fingers as the hair tickled back and forth under her nasal cavity, and the itchy expression on her face could have been taken from Liz’s own. Of course, she realized, if it had been her the next thing she’d do would be—

SSNNNNNFFFFFFFFF!!!

Stephanie’s nostrils flared wide and her head tilted back slightly as she have a massive sniff, sucking in the dusty air. Jake was drawn screaming into the depths of her nose, along with the hair. She wiggled her nose once, still itchy.

“Sorry, I just... what?” She asked, seeing Liz’s aghast expression.






How does Liz react?
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.title: Getting itchy

choices: Stephanie sneezes Jake into her hands
Jake is launched somewhere else in the attic
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.content:
"Oh!" exclaimed Beth, who had spaced out while watching Stephanie attempt to fight off the tickle in her nose. Beth was torn between telling Stephanie what she knew and -- well, there really wasn't another option, was there? For Jake's safety, Beth found the courage to bring up the bizarre and uncomfortable topic yet again.

"I think you just -- er -- Jake is up your nose," Beth declared, pointing to the center of her friend's face.

Stephanie somehow managed to turn both red from embarassment and white from anxiety. "W-what?" she stammered at first. "Oh, come on, are you still on about him?" she rubbed at her nose. "I told you before--"

"No, seriously, Steph. Look, I don't care right now how any of this happened but I know what I saw before and I know what I just saw right now and I'm telling you your brother is up your nose! So don't sniff or rub your nose or anything!"

Upon hearing Beth, an unhappy Jake rolled over inside his sister's nose a little more optimistically. Hey, the plan worked -- sort of! Jake proclaimed to himself. He had successfully gotten the girls' attention. But how was he going to get out of here? He had been sucked awfully deep in and it was essentially pitch black.

Conflicting thoughts raced through Stephanie's head, all while her nose continued to tickle. She knew what she had done to Jake, but it was supposed to be temporary, and she certainly hadn't foreseen a situation as ridiculous as the one she was currently in. "But it tickles!" she protested to Beth. "And I'm trying not to sneeze! Besides, I don't think that would be too much fun for him either."

"It's still better than totally inhaling him!" Beth reasoned. "Try blowing him out! Here, take this tissue..."

Jake, revolted at the idea of being blown into a tissue by his sister, panicked. Instinctively, he waved his arms around in the complete darkness and called out for attention. "Wait! Steph!" His arms made contact with a nose hair that hung down from the top of the nostril. Without thinking, he grabbed it with one hand and shook it like someone ringing an old-fashioned alarm bell. "Wait! Don't!"

He couldn't see it, but Stephanie's eyes immediately teared up when Jake tugged on her nose hair. He could, however, hear his sister let out a desparate hitched breath as she prepared to, now involuntarily, blow him out of her nose.
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.title: Tell Steph where Jake is

1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.content:
"Oh! No, uh -- nothing, it's just..." Beth stammered, realizing how shocked she must have looked upon noticing Jake finding his way into Stephanie's nose. Beth worried that Stephanie's sniffing could suck Jake into the depths of her respiratory passages, but Beth hesitated to announce what she knew to be true to her friend. Instead:

"It's just, you look like you need to sneeze, and, well, I can relate."

"Ha!" Stephanie responded. "No, it's just dusty up here, I guess." She rubbed at her nose and sniffed again.

"No, don't!" Beth warned instinctively.

"Jeez, what's your problem, Beth?" Stephanie asked, taken aback.

"Don't sniff, it'll only make it worse. Trust me. Blow out or just sneeze!"

"I don't have to sneeze!" Stephanie argued. "Thanks for your advice, but I can handle myself."

Good! Jake thought to himself. The last thing he needed was for his sister to sneeze. Speaking of which, he should probably get those hairs of hers completely out of her nose...

It sounds like Beth noticed me, though! But then why the hell is she trying to get Steph to sneeze? he wondered. Unless, maybe she's right...? Maybe that would be better than getting snorted into who-knows-where...
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.title: Try to get her to sneeze him out

1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.content:
Stephanie wiggled and scrunched her nose, the soft organ squirming around her face in irritation. Despite her bravado, the itching in her nose was getting worse and worse. From the way her sinuses were starting to prickle, she knew a sneeze was going to come soon if she didn't do something.

It would be simpler to just let it out, but after Beth had been so bossy she didn't want to give her the satisfaction. Eyes starting to wafter a little, Steph looked at Beth and deliberately sniffed as hard as she could.

SSSNNNNNNRRRRRKKKKK!!!

Steph's round nostrils flared to the size of marbles as the sound of a loud, undignified snort echoed off the attic walls. Her cheeks colored. She hadn't meant for it to be so loud-!

* * *

The snort sucked Jake far, far back in Stephanie's nose. This deep, the twilight that filtered in from the distant nostril was badly enough to see his hand in front of his face, let alone the cavernous nasal roof somewhere above in the gloom. The pink walls here were smooth and hairless, coated in thick mucus which also hung in glittering streamers down from the hidden celling. This wasn't a place in Stephanie's body where any solid object was meant to go...
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.title: Jake is sniffed further in

choices: A light at the end of the tunnel
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.content:
"Uggh," Jake groaned. "Seriously?!" Beth was on to something -- now I don't even know where the hell I am!" he complained.

Beth's eyes were wide; she knew Jake must be in trouble now, but what could she do about it, besides trying to explain the situation again? That was an uncomfortable road she didn't really want to go down again.

Stephanie rubbed at her nose. The sniff had done its job at fighting off the tickle for now.

Inside Stephanie's nose, Jake decided among his options. He could barely see a damned thing, and his sense of orientation had been completely ruined when he was sucked up here. If he was going to move around and try to find his way out, he would have to make sure he wasn't heading in the wrong direction, or else he might accidentally slip right down his sister's throat.

Nervous about the prospect of being digested, Jake decided that the only safe way to move around would be to crawl slowly and use his hands to feel the upcoming "ground" as he went so he could avoid any dangerous slope.

I am really deep, though, Jake considered. This part of her nose is probably super sensitive ... I shouldn't be rubbing my hands all over it. As the thought of being digested reared itself again in Jake's mind, however, he quickly reconsidered. Screw it. At least if she sneezes I'll be moving in the right direction.

Getting down on all fours, Jake began cautiously feeling his way around, moving his hands to contact the surrounding moist flesh and orient himself. This is disgusting, Jake grimaced as his fingertips felt his wet environment.

Jake continued his slow trek. He hadn't felt any dangerous slope yet, which was a good sign, but it was still very dark, which was not a good sign. God, I hope I'm going the right way.
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.title: Jake explores

choices: Somehow Steph manages to hold in her sneeze.
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.content:
Stephanie's eyes widened in something close to panic as a sudden sharp tickle spiked through the back of her nose. Immediately the baby-blue orbs began to well with tears as her body responded to Jake's intrusion. Stephanie's nostrils began to quiver, her chest swelling as she drew an involuntary breath.

"Ihhhhhhh..."

Jake froze at the sound, but the damage had already been done. The dim fleshy cavern quaked around him as Stephanie's willpower fought again her body's increasingly desperate urge to expel the foreign body that had found it's way into her nasal passages.

It would be so, so much easier to just let the the sneeze take it's course, but Stephanie's stubborn streak wouldn't let her let Beth be right about her blindingly obvious need to sneeze. Her face went red as she frantically scrubbed at her nose, struggling to contain the building explosion.

"I-I... d-dohhh... dehhh.... don't n-need... t-t-t-to snehhHH... EHH..."

1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.content:
"Oh, for God's sake," Jake rolled his eyes as he heard his sister's stubborn opposition to the obviously impending sneeze.

Beth just watched in amazement as her friend fought it back.

"It's -- HAA! -- just a ... just a little -- haahhh -- tickle..." Stephanie lied, her eyes nearly completely shut.

Jake had already accepted his fate; at this point he really didn't care. He just hoped he would land somewhere soft. Growing tired of the anticipation, Jake firmly planted all his fingertips in the ground of his sister's nostril and wiggled them around quickly. "Here, I'll help you out, sis..."

Stephanie's eyes watered so much that when they involuntarily snapped shut a single tear rolled down her cheek.

"HAAAA -- HAAAACHOOOOO!" she let loose.
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.title: ACHOO!!!

1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.content:
"-AAAACHOOOOO!!!"

Jake was blasted from Stephanie’s nose like a cannon as her itching sinuses finally erupted despite her best efforts, catapulting him out of his sister’s flaring nostrils and through space. The attic blurred dizzyingly around him as he flew, and Jake had just enough time to notice that a pinkish blur was getting bigger fast before—

THUD.

It really had been one of the biggest sneezes of Steph’s life, and at the end the itch had been bad enough that the poor girl hadn’t thought to check where she was sneezing. As a result, Steph accidentally sneezed directly onto her friend. Liz flinched in shock as Jake hit her chest along with countless other droplets of spray and mucus.

Jake scrabbled frantically at the pink surface, trying to get a grip. He’d found handholds on skin before–! But it was too late. Before Jake could get purchase on the smooth skin, gravity took over, dragging him tumbling down into the dark chasm of Liz’s cleavage.

Fortunately for Jake, Liz had a rather pronounced chest. She usually downplayed it through her shyness and the way she dressed, but she was actually quite busty. As a result, she’d gotten into the habit of tucking things between her breasts when she didn’t want to root around in her backpack for them and didn’t have any pockets. So, instead of being crushed between Liz’s breasts or falling all the way down her shirt, Jake landed hard on something white nestled between the two globes.

Groaning, he rolled over, trying to figure out what he’d landed on. It was…
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.title: Jake ends up somewhere else in the attic

1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.content:
"Ugh," a disoriented Jake moaned. I should have learned my lesson about going inside other people's noses from being inside Beth's already, he admitted. At least Steph's isn't as sensitive, he reasoned. Although I did just stick a bunch of hairs up it...

Beth looked at Steph with fear in her eyes. Steph could have just sucked Jake into her lungs with a sniff like that!

Jake tried to prop himself upright on the slimy ground, but quickly discovered that that might not be possible. "Oh, what the -- seriously?" he complained, trying to free his arms, which seemed to be plastered to the ground. "That's disgusting!" he grimaced.

Jake wrestled fruitlessly a little bit more, then plopped the back of his head down on the ground, discouraged. "STEPH!" he bellowed. "Steph! Help!"
1222222122111211112122212121122111221212.title: Jake is stuck!

Jake couldn't be too mad at Beth for allowing Stephanie to redirect the subject; his sister was quite manipulative. Clearly, though, getting Stephanie's attention was going to be a job left completely up to Jake himself.

The shrunken young man sighed. Looking up, he figured the best course of action was to wave something, like the lock of curly blonde hair secured around his waist, in front of his sister's eye to get her attention. Then again, it was pretty dark in the attic -- she might not even notice.

124.content:
Jake doesn't have long to stare at the person in the desk before they suddenly jump up from their chair. Falling over in surprise, Jake quickly pushes himself back up in time to see the girl at the desk run over to her dresser. She still looks a little familiar, but Jake can't seem to remember her name. After looking at herself in the mirror, the girl begins to apply some makeup to her face, brushing it over her cheeks and her sharply upturned nose.

"Hey, Brianna!" comes a voice from outside the door, startling both Jake and the girl. He can tell immediately that it's Stephanie, and upon hearing the name Brianna he does recognize the girl somewhat. They don't know each other terribly well, but Jake is pretty sure they've at least met.

"I'm almost done! Just a sec!" Brianna replies, turning back to her mirror. She brushes a bit more makeup onto her nose and giggles at herself. Meanwhile Jake realizes he doesn't have a ton of options. Maybe he should just stay put and hope he's dreaming. Brianna might be of some help, but there's always a risk with Stephanie's friends...
